Reviews.Title: “A short metro ride from the major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay at the hotel was pretty good. The reception staff were helpful and the hotel itself is a short walk from the nearest metro station. The rooms were pretty clean and fairly spacious. Breakfast was typical continental buffet style ad came as part of the deal when booking the room. It's a short metro ride away from the major attractions in the city of Rome about a 10-15 minute journey.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Flaviauk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during 3 nights in April 2012, the hotel is on easy location, close to shops, underground and restaurants. The room and bathroom were fine, good size and clean. The breakfast wasn't that good, very poor variety of breads, jams, no cheese, juices and fruits. The room was very dry and hot, turning the nights difficult to sleep due the noise from cars outside once is necessity to keep the windows opened. Very expensive parking (€25). Nice and warm staffs., very helpfull and good English speakers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mjcmoppel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with my wife and daughter over Easter 2012. The hotel is officially 3 star. However it's facilities in my opinion are that of 4 star. I think that the only reason it isn't classified as 4 star is that the hotel does not have a restaurant. The hotel itself is modern, very clean and in a safe residential neighbourhood, just outside the tourist centre of Rome. Our hotel room accommodated 3 adults and was very clean and modern. The room was also quiet and had satellite television with many channels in Italian, plus BBC CNN, ZDF Antenne 2, Sat1 etc. We also booked breakfast everyday and it is served in a nice room on a buffet self-service style. The hotel is about 5 minutes walk from the Piazza Bologna metro station (line B) - take the Via Ravenna exit. It is also a 10 minute walk up the hill from Rome Tiburtina rail station (second biggest in Rome). Also very close to the 62 bus route that goes downtown. We went to a couple of nice restaurants very close to the hotel (2 minutes walk). One was called Il Tunnel and the other was called La Lanterna. Both similar price. Il Tunnel was a bit more informal and La Lanterna a little more upmarket. Both served good traditional Italian food and wine. Both very enjoyable. Tip - if you want to go to the Vatican Museum the queues were massive. You may wish to book online to save a long wait. Thank you to the staff of Mercure Roma Piazza Bologna. We will come again! Greetings from England.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice,new and clean hotel near center”
Reviews.Author: spygr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new next to the metro station near the center of Rome.The room was clean and all the staff was very kind and helpfull.They offered free wifi access.I suggest this hotel for a nice stay in Rome for a weekend or more and for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Anna N
Reviews.Content: We've choose this hotel because of the location and price. I have booked and prepaid it in advance and it was pleasant to realize that I have saved 80 Euro. But when we came there it occurred that we have to pay 50 Euro for Parking. We did so, because in Rome parking is the only thing that you will never find! There are an Underground station near the Hotel - 15 minutes to Coleseo. Take breakfast, if you don't want to spend time, looking for a suitable place to eat. We had a great time in Rome, and the Hotel was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed, would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii_Lovers_26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2012 and were very impressed! Spacious room by European standards and we had windows on two full sides of the room (corner room), which we enjoyed. Staff was friendly, building was clean. Near a good amount of restaurants and shops, as well as public transportation. About a 15-20 minute bus ride from the popular tourist attractions such as the Colosseum, etc. We would highly recommend this and would stay again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel not too far from the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: charlie1111Leeds
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet residential area. It is about 5 minutes walk from the Bologna subway station, which is 4 stops from Roma Termini station. You can connect to all the rest of rome from here. If you arrive by train to Termini, just need to change to the subway to reach this location. Around the hotel, there are some cafes and restaurants, but we tended to eat in the tourist areas in the centre of Rome. Rooms are of reasonable size for a city hotel, they were clean and upto date. Half the price of the Mercure in the centre of Rome so reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY hotel, room was small and depressing!”
Reviews.Author: CharlieFrance
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercure Roma Piazza Bologna in March 2012. I paid 78 euros per night for four nights excluding breakfast. I booked via accorhotels.com. The room I was given on the third floor was very small and dark.The bathroom desperately needed to be repaired. There was a constant brown stain in the toilet bowl. There was no plug so I could not have a bath. Noise was a big problem in this hotel. Doors were slammed throughout the night, so I did not sleep well (even with ear plugs). One night a group of drunken youths ran up and down the corridor shouting their heads off at 2am. I called to reception but no action was taken. The staff at reception kindly put me in a big room on the 5th floor for my last night which was a bit better, but you still could hear doors slamming and the conversation in the next room!!! I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. I thought the hotel was below the usual Mercure standards.

Reviews.Title: “Staying with the locals.”
Reviews.Author: JasonMarni
Reviews.Content: Very close to the metro stop, it was lovely to walk around the suburb. We came across some little restaurants which were excellent value compared to the centre of Rome. Alla LAnturna ristorante and pizzeria was a tiny treasure with the most amazing pistachio spaghetti. Lovely places for coffee and gelato nearby also. The room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, the WiFi is not free.”
Reviews.Author: Simone129
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but clean. During summer I found winter blankets (two times). The wifi is not free.

Reviews.Title: “booked at half price, good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel during Accor's promotion, which is only 65 Euro / night. I stayed here for 4 nights. The location is a little bit far from the city center, however the nearby community is nice, safe and beautiful. The hotel is on metro Line B, just three stops away from the central ternimi. But I like to take bus, clean and good for sightseeing. There are direct bus connections from the hotel to Vatican, Novana Piazza, and Borghese Galleria, just ask the receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: cu52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem just outside the city center. It is in the University area and you can find a couple places to eat that are a better value for money than in the center of Rome. Bologna metro station is only three stops from Termini and about a 5 minute walk from there to the hotel. Very easy with bags just make sure you exist through entrance B to put you on the right side of the roundabout. I travelled with my family and there are no adjoining rooms but the staff did their best to accommodate and gave us two rooms side by side. We were on the second floor and did not have any issues with street noise; it is in a quite section of town. Beds were good, only downside was breakfast was more of a continental style. Although when comparing it to the prices outside for breakfast it was not a bad value for money, just not overly impressive. This hotel is a safe bet if you are traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Value for Money..”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The team is very helpful. hotel is neat and clean. We liked it. Hospitality is good, Clean rooms, We had very nice time. Good view of city center, Hops to shopping center, food courts and metro stations. Overall its fun full place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jay4eff
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with very modern rooms and facilities. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast was plentiful and tasty. It is a short distance from the metro and is perfectly located for local restaurants and bars serving food and drinks at half the city centre prices. Others have commented that the rooms are small, they are but have high quality fittings. I would highly recommend this hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay overall”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was small but so are most rooms in most hotels in Rome. The breakfast, however, was rather poor, with much less choice than usually available in other Mercure properties. The location, however, is great as is the local Il Tunnel restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: gumguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single room on the second floor for five nights. The front desk staff were very helpful when I asked for directions or to use the Internet. The room and bath were cleaned daily and it was a good basic room and quiet. Breakfast was ready everyday at 6:30 and was adequate. The area was residential with bus 62 stopping at the corner on a regular basis for access to downtown Rome, or taxis easily available. Too far to walk downtown. Nice restaurant ElTunnel one block away, and nice gelato and sandwich shops on the corner also. Overall, a nice clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: eng98 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet residential area, which I think it is a good change from the rest of the crowded area of rome. It is about 5 minutes walk from the Bologna subway station, which is 4 stops from Roma Termini. You can connect to all the rest of rome from here. If you arrive by train to Termini, just need to change to the subway to reach this location. Do note that there are quite a few flight of stairs to conquer in the subway stations. Around the hotel, there are some cafes and restaurants, so no problem if you want to eat out. For the hotel, service is ok. I didn't asked for much thing. Do note that they are giving free Wifi. However this was not told to me anytime I was there. It was the night before I left, I happened to pick up a brochure on the hotel and saw it printed there. I had expected the front desk to inform during check-in. Rooms are rather small. We had 2 toll luggages and we literally have to leave and open them next to the door. Bed and pillows were too soft for me. So i recommend to bring along a travel pillow. That helps. I will recommend this place if it doesn't cost too much and you are looking for a quieter place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, watch out for smoking rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly staff. Location was good - in a residential suburb a few stations out of the main tourist areas but it was actually nice to see some locals. Only issue was that we were put in a very strong smelling smoking room our first night, but the staff were nice and fixed it up when they could.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, POOR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Mercure was one of the better hotels we stayed at in Italy however the service was very poor. Staff had little or no knowledge or were unwilling to share their knowledge of the area. We had a full breakfast the first morning that was not good. DO NOT BOTHER WITH FULL BREAKFAST SERVICE. We had to press staff to refill and replace eggs, tea, fruit juice. There was very little available. Kitchen staff did not appear concerned about lack of food. Next day we did the Bar Breakfast, this was much better.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel 5 mn from Piazza Bologna Subway”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very hospitable and available. We enjoy our stay there!!! The hotel is located 5mn from Piazza Bologna Subway and 15 mn from Coliseo. The 62 bus goes directly to Saint Peter Church after going across Central Roma! The room are nice and neat. The breakfast is good too!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: OzCru
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in suburban Rome, but within 5 mins walk of the nearest Metro station and only 3 stops to the all-important Termini station. We loved the local ambience, bars, shops and eateries. Hotel could do with a concierge and more literature in English. Some staff were more helpful than others. The bar staff were lovely, knowledgeable and engaged with guests. Rooms were standard Mercure, breakfast was a mixed bag - great continental, poor attempt at full English/American - and staff tended to start clearing away or not replacing empty serving dishes well before the official closing time. However, we enjoyed our stay and we would go back, if only for the respite from the tourist hordes offered by the location.

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nicely located very close to Bologna metro station. Clean rooms with decor very much like any standard NH hotel. Also close to Termini. Located in peaceful residential area. Close to qschool but not noisy. Only downside is the lack of good in house facility for food. The buffet breakfast is also quite unimpressive

Reviews.Title: “Good location and rooms, too bad about the service”
Reviews.Author: luv2holiday81
Reviews.Content: We only had a short time to spend in Rome so wanted to make the most of it, which staying at this hotel didn't help. We arrived earlier than the check in time so understand we could not be accommodated straight away however were told to return at 3pm when our confirmation details booked through the accor site indicated 2pm was checkin time which pointed out to them. When we returned at 2pm they said to wait 10min which was fine, however 10min turned in 50min jus to checks in! I've never experienced a slower check in procedure in my entire life and the guy at the front desk was constantly being interrupted by other staff chatting away and was also extremely slow himself. When we finally finished check in which was now after 3pm we went to our room and found the cleaner just finishing up there with bags of linen and trolley in the hallway. The room we realized was not made up with a double bed as what we booked, it was 2 singles so we had to inform reception and wait once again while they rectified it, so sat in the hallway on the stairs while the room was re-made.... Not how we had wanted start our trip in Rome! We also found a slow service response when trying to get information about the train strike and if it affected our train to naples and also the removal of a stinking rotting moss filled cactus in the lobby area....overall the room was nice and comfortable and the hotel is in a good location with easy access to the metro and buses but the service really let this hotel down which would make me think twice about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL, but suites avail”
Reviews.Author: Sonny_tmcf
Reviews.Content: Clean... Check... Buffet... Miss... Rooms, small VERY SMALL ... Unless you upgrade.. Bar on site, resteraunts within walking distance, gelato... Outside the city limit, but on a bus line..

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: fbarros
Reviews.Content: great option for Rome´s first visitors. good location, with sub nearby, nice staff, nice & new rooms...nothing to complain, at all!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, shabby service, lots of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: Nomad77_11
Reviews.Content: Standard Accor hotel, on par with Novotel, reasonably clean. For me personally, location worked very well (prefer to be in a residential area away from the tourist buzz, to feel the real city life). Metro is nearby and after-hours return with the official white taxi from the city center was barely 12 euros with the tip. (15 euros from Trastevere) The best thing about the whole stay was that we had the huge balcony overlooking the residential street. Rooms are very small and we actually had a "privilege" room so I'm imagining how small the other rooms are. Apart from the nice balcony, nothing was really "privilege" about the stay. Upon arrival, we discovered used and dirty espresso cups on the desk. Internet is free in this type of room but since when is internet a privilege, it's free in any other hotel. Had to get the refill cards constantly (which you need to buy from the front desk if in normal room), and the wi-fi signal was shabby, and internet disrupted at times. Had the slippers and bathrobe but that's pretty standard in some other Mercure hotels I stayed in. The biggest turn off was the impression that hotel and staff wanted to rip-us off at every corner. Breakfast is not included and it's 13 euros per person. Went instead to the local cafe around the corner and had bunch of fresh paninis, wonderful cappuccino and orange juice - 12 euros for 2 persons. Parking was 25 Euros per night! And also very small, you need to be very skilled to park your car in. When asked for laundromat in the area staff offered to do the dry cleaning, 4 euros per shirt. Declined and discovered the laundromat just across the street , wash, dry and fold service for a huge bag of clothing, that's at least 20lbs, for mere 15 euros! Worst was to come - the completely false information about the taxi to the FCO airport, we were informed that the taxi ride will be 55 euros (story about how they charge for bags, then to get to the Termini station etc) and that we should take the private driver and limo instead which they will call for us. Declined again, stopped the 1st taxi around Bologna square, and for 40 euros got very fast to the FCO. They do not go to Termini at all, and no charge for luggage. Very untrustworthy staff and not working for the customer. Not returning

Reviews.Title: “Good value for $$”
Reviews.Author: Alescna Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located a little away from the sights, but the Metro is just around the corner so still quite convenient. Great value for money and staff were impeccable. Rooms were clean, neat and still quite new. Lots of good food places around (Mizzica, just across does fantastic pastries and gelato - locals hang out here every night - a plus!) They have a pickup laundry service, but the laundromat across the road was cheaper and just as quick!

Reviews.Title: “Good price for good hotel”
Reviews.Author: daveErwin
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for a citytrip in june 2011. This hotel is on 3 minutes to the metro an so you are in 20 minutes in the center. Hotel is not big and on quite location. No street sounds on our room. Good beds, nice room. Service is OK. Breakfast buffet is good but pricy. Bar not that good (beer was not cold) Concluded : Good hotel for the price and purpose

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PauloPatricio
Reviews.Content: Good, clean and confortable hotel at a residential + commercial area in Rome. Well located, near restaurants, cooffe shops and a subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neil1969_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights and found it a great location, comfortable and affordably priced. Only a few stops by Metro from central Rome, or take the bus from Piazza Bologne. Great shops, restaurants and bakery nearby. A good affordable location for a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice, cosy, intimate room.The room was very clean. The hotel staff was very kind and helpfull. Great location, couple of minutes from the subway. Very quiet location. Lots of cafeterias, pizzerias, restaurants and shops nearby the hotel. I really enjoyed staying there. I will come back here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Fabricio C
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is not really close to the turistic points in Rome, but it is 2 minutes walking from a Metro Station that can connect to everything. It also has a coffee shop aside that is really good for breakfast or even lunch , and a great pizzaria/cantina with delicious food and good prices for dinner. Staff was outstanding, specially the recepcionist Francesco, who helped us with a personnal issue during our trip. As other reviews has said, the room is small, but perfect for a couple. The only one thing that we didn`t like was that in the shower area there were no curtain, so the bathroom got a little wet after the bath. All the rest was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.”
Reviews.Author: Azaleah Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mercure Roma Piazza Bologna's rooms were clean but small. They have AC, a good sturdy bed, and extra pillows to allow a comfortable sleep though. The location was far by foot from anything interesting, although nearby Piazza Bologna had an abundance of buses that connect you to the city centre. There was also a metro stop, but we preferred travelling by bus because it can get so hot and stuffy in Rome's metro tunnels. The staff was pleasant enough, but they aren't as flexible as other Accor hotels we've stayed in. As an example, we asked for more toilet paper so we don't need to ask again as we were staying for several nights, but they only gave us one. We asked if we could borrow an iron and board, they said they don't allow bringing the iron to the rooms and we'd need to go downstairs to iron our clothes. In summary, an okay stay, but if you can spend more, try a hotel closer to the centre with better reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Andre_Brasil
Reviews.Content: This is a great deal, considering the rates. Bed confortable, bathroom nice and room very quiet. Hotel is just few meters from the subway station. The Bologna neighborhood is safe but there are not many restaurant options.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The elevator is very small for buggy! The internet connection is very expensive. The room is clear, Its OK! Every day same breakfast. The bathroom is nice and clean. The metro station is close. The recepcion services is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “You can find better for the price, since wifi is not included.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The internet service went down after I paid for it. When I complained, one of the hotel receptionists treated me like I was trying to avoid paying for internet. He condescendingly explained to me that the internet voucher is only valid 24 consecutive hours and that my time expired, and so that explained why my internet wasn't working again (he was jumping to a wrong conclusion). My frustration grew as i tried to clarify what i was telling him when i realized he hadn't understood my problem. But it was futile because he was not even listening to me anymore. The following day/night, the Vodafone network was down altogether in the hotel. So I was left with using the Swisscom computer in the lobby. Since it was Swisscom, even though I was forced to pay Vodafone TWICE for internet that same day, I had to pay again, that is, a THIRD time, to use the Swisscom internet. I felt ripped off and completely on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special and poor restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Andrey_Buzin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an average Mercure hotel. Quite friendly and helpful frontdesk staff was well compensated by simply awful breakfast. We had it twice and both times bacon and croixants were burn to the state of coal. As for everything else - no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was our home away from home in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MsPiggy858
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! From the very start we were impressed! Our group had 4 rooms, all of which were very similar but had varying sizes. Ours was the smallest, probably equivalent to the average NYC hotel room. The furnishings were nice, new, and modern with a very pleasing look. The entire hotel even smelled wonderful from the lobby all through the halls and into our room. It smelled like fresh clean soap! The beds were so comfortable with lovely down comforters. It was the best sleep we had through our entire Italy experience! We took advantage of the lovely courtyard off of the lobby. Here we ate lunch that we would buy at nearby cafes. We also discovered a balcony on the 6th floor that was open for guests. It was a lovely place to sit and enjoy a drink late at night. The breakfast offered by the hotel was wonderful. We loved the variety of hot pastries that would come from the kitchen and there was a wonderful coffee/beverage machine that made a big variety of coffee, tea, and hot chocolate. The location is just 2-3 blocks from the Bologna Metro stop, which made this hotel a very convenient place to stay away from the crowds of Rome. Take advantage of the local cafes which are open from morning until very late at night. They were wonderful! There will be crowds of locals there, which indicates how great they are!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable and enjoyable hotel for the deal of BB+free internet with advance reservation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reasonable and enjoyable hotel for the deal of 2 nights BB+free internet with advance reservation I recommend the deal 2 BB+free internet, 2 bed spacious room at high floor with nice Roma view - 265 Euro as Accor member

Reviews.Title: “Good location, safe area, proper Italian!”
Reviews.Author: Oshel
Reviews.Content: The staff are helpful, Rooms on the small size but big enough, Comfy beds. Location excellent, 5 min walk to the metro station and plenty of restaurants and coffee shops on the way - all at very good prices. We got breakfast a local cafe - massive crossiant and cappucino €2

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HammadHassan Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay. Near Metro stop. Rooms are good. Price a bit high but if compared to rest of the city hotels seems fine. Internet very expensive, needs to be free at torist place hotels. But overall recommended for stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel in a Lovely suburb...”
Reviews.Author: TickleOnTheTum
Reviews.Content: Booked: - Room for 2 adults (room only). Purpose of Trip: - To visit the main attractions in Rome so basically needed somewhere to sleep as would be spending all our time in central Rome. Likes: - Clean and modern furnished rooms (cleaners friendly and helpful). - Helpful reception staff. - Easy to get to central Rome where main attractions are (approx 10 minute tube ride). - Tea and coffee facilities provided. - Hotel is a very short walk from tube station. - Bologna is a nice suburb of Rome and we felt very safe there. - Nearby Pizza and Bakery shops. Dislikes: - Rooms are small so not much room to move about (although we were barely in the room so we’re not worried about this). Would I Recommend: - Yes, definitely. Despite the rooms being small, the beds were comfortable and the rooms were very clean which is a key selling point for us. We would definitely go back. Tips: - If you are in Rome for 3 days, purchase a Roma Pass as they are well worth the money. The Roma Pass allows you to travel on as many train and bus trips as you like within Rome and you also get entry to two tourist attractions for free and discounts on many other attractions. Some attractions also allow you to avoid queuing if you have a Roma Pass. - There are many beggars in Rome and we would suggest that you do not give them any money. Our observations of the beggars was that: 1) many of the beggars operate on a “Fagin” basis, i.e. they beg for money and give it to a man in charge of them, 2) some beggars wore expensive clothes and were clean and tidy (one beggar was wearing a leather coat!) and 3) they want money not food (we offered a beggar some food but they threw it away when they thought we weren’t looking which suggests to us that they’re not that desperate).

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel close to transport and centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bazzer13 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel ticks all the box's when it comes to quality, price, and location. Just a short metro journey to most of the sights in Rome and in a pleasant and safe area... Highly recommended. We stayed here for just one night as we went to the Ibis Magliana in Rome for 2 nights the week before...... "what a mistake to make" The Mercure was modern, clean, and welcoming, and the staff were very helpful, but book early to avoid dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: outandaboutpriya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in an area which is not too touristy and yet with its proximity to the Metro station, is not too difficult to get around Rome. The Bologna station is just two stops away from the Roma Termini, the central location leading to all sightseeing in Rome. The area is a nice, quiet, residential area and has quite a few good and inexpensive eating joints around. All in all a great place to stay for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Happy stay and valuable location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: location of hotel for family trip, it is perfect location. Service of front and house keeping, all of staffs know hotel services very well. There are very lots of nice restaurants especially cookies and ice cream shop within 2 minutes. Bus transportations to Center of Rome also located at plaza bologna together with metro within 2 minutes walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Ok and clean”
Reviews.Author: MichelFIN
Reviews.Content: We had a normal double room which was very small... The aircondition is poorly placed in the room, it blows cold air straight to the bed, meaning that you will get cold after the first night. We did shut down the aircon the second night which caused a very hot room during the night... at least the room was very well cleaned with the bathroom shining and the whole feeling in the room and hotel is modern and pleasant. The paperthin walls let some noise come to the room from the other rooms (and hallway also) which wasn't nice. The breakfast was a bit awful, not having many choices of what to eat... the coffee was propably the worst I have ever had in a hotel in Europe, what a shame to the Italian coffee culture. The coffee was produced by some old Nescafe machine (!!).... The price/quality ratio is a bit on the expensive side, hotels are never cheap in Rome, but somehow I would have wanted a bit more bang for my money. At least it was a clean and modern hotel. And again, Wi-Fi should be free of charge!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK But I hate paying for the internet.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice enough place, rooms not too big but they had everything. Such a shame that the wifi is not free, it wouldn't cost the hotel much to provide free wifi but linking up with vodafone just seems a way to fleece its customers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: brazturk
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean and modern hotel. Close to metro station. Try to avoid the rooms on top of the main entrance, since there is a lot of noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Poor standard”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small no space for relaxsation unless you should lay on the bed. The room needed a brush up and an extra clean. The hotel needs space to relax. The breakfast was very poor to the cost. All bread was burned and not only 1 day but every day. We didn`t feel like paying for this and went to the other side of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but quite good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed for three nights at Mercure Piazza Bologna and had a fairly good experience. The hotel is well located - off the city centre, but still easy to reach, with good bus and underground connections. The area is residential and quiet (not even the primary school next door was a nuisance), with lots of small, independent shops and restaurants. By the way, don't bother having breakfast at the hotel: you get better food for much better prices in the cafes nearby. Room and bathroom were what you would expect from a Mercure: compact, but of sufficient size; comfortable and clean. Wi-fi access is expensive. Not many people go to Rome to stay on their computers, but it would be nice to have Internet to help with the plans for the day (not everyone has a smartphone, Mercure!). Staff could definitely be more friendly and helpful. I didn't have any major problems, but they don't make any effort whatsoever to make you feel welcome to the city or the hotel. They could also make clear that the city tax (€2/day/person) is not included in the fee and will be charged separately at check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: RobFromLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in May 2011. It is as you would expect from the Mercure brand - clean and comfortable, but with little personality. It was a little way from the City centre, so we had to take a short (10 minutes) ride on the Metro to get where we needed to be, but this wasn't a problem. We found the hotel to be considerably cheaper than similar properties closer to the centre, so the hardship of taking the Metro was worth it. My only grumble was that they charged an extortionate amount for wi-fi (7 Euros / hour) - in this day and age, this should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, if you use public transport”
Reviews.Author: LS13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated a couple of stops North of Termini station so is quite quick to reach by Metro. On a night, after 11.30 we used the number 62 bus which leaves from near Campo Fiori where many bars and restaurants are. I mention this first, as if you don't want to use public transport, the location of the hotel may be a problem. We asked a taxi driver the price to Colloseum Metro and were quoted 20 euros. I'm not sure of thats a fair price, but if you have to use taxis, that would add to the cost significantly and you may be better staying closer to the centre. The hotel itself was fine--like any Mercure hotel, it was clean, functional and decorated in Accors usual livery. The staff spoke good English and the location meant to the hotel was quiet and I slept very well. Breakfast was additional cost and you'd probably be better getting something in one of the local bars , as this seemed quite expensive. In summary, a well priced hotel for a capital city, but be prepared for some public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is fine for what we needed. As with most hotels, the rooms are relatively small but adequate. Staff were friendly and helpful in getting us information and directions. There is a local tram that is across the street which will take you to the Duomo. So as long as you don't mind the distance you need to travel, it's fine. There's a very good restaurant just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but no free Wifi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A pitty there is no free wifi hotspot in the lobby. I don't even ask free wifi in the rooms, but at least in the lobby. This hotel will not be an option in the future. I need free wifi to occasionally check my mails and do other leisure stuff like plan the visit of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic !!!!”
Reviews.Author: minnifinn
Reviews.Content: Great staff, nice, clean rooms, ecellent breakfast. Extreamly short walk to nearest metro (piazza Bologna) lots of shops, cafes nearby. Buss numero 62 just opposite metro station. And other busses next corner. Rooms with bathtub !! So you can enjoy strawberries and champagne in tub........WERY comfy beds, just great to sleep. Staff extreamly nice and helpful. Breakfast was big considering it cost only 13e/pers. Defenetly going back this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quiet area but close to the centre”
Reviews.Author: A_Bernadett
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for people who prefer to stay in a quiet area with local people but only 3 metro station from Termini. The metro station is 2 minutes away from the hotel. The hotel is clean and has 24 hours reception. All in all it is a good 3 star hotel. The breakfast is too expensive, it is much better to eat out in a local café where you can buy e.g. hot panini.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel outside city centre”
Reviews.Author: PandJ99
Reviews.Content: Good, clean, standard international chain hotel. It is out of the city centre - too far to walk to the tourist trail but very convenient for a Metro station (Piazza Bologna) which makes it about 20 minutes to the tourist sites. Rooms bigger and better standard than most others I've experienced in Rome. No restaurant for evening meal but good value local restaurants available (particularly Il Tunnel 2 minutes walk away). Front desk staff very helpful. We managed to get a good deal so our stay was very good value (but would be distinctly average value at the rack rate advertised in hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great contemporary hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: KJC01186220
Reviews.Content: Overall a great hotel very clean and good service, close to metro so a great base for tourists as long as you don't mind a bit of walking and changing lines, couple of bakeries close by but struggled to find any restaurants close to the hotel so had to get back on metro. termini station tended to always be manic and very busy so be prepared to be pushed and shoved apart from that metro was pretty good. To jump queues you can buy tickets for Vatican museum online and then buy headsets there and can also get a roma pass online which is worth it covers travel for three days and entry into museums we used ours for colosseum and again jumped queues. Just a note on eating out lots of restaurants have outdoor seating and only some have patio style heaters so take a big coat as even with indoor seating they tend to leave doors wide open. Cafes also didn't have much seating everyone tends to stand at counters and eat there, not great if you have been on your feet all day.

Reviews.Title: “Bologna-rific!!”
Reviews.Author: luciesmith1984 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, quiet & clean. Very friendly English speaking staff. 5 minute walk to Piazza Bologna metro station and 3 stops to the Termini main station.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel on outskirts of rome”
Reviews.Author: bren53 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this is a very good 3 star hotel only 5/10 minutes from termini by line B. The hotel is surrounded by some excellent and good value cafes and restaurants which are less expensive than in centre of rome. I found public transport excellent value by buying a 3 day travel card for €11

Reviews.Title: “good value, close to the center (subway)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we had a pleasant stay, the bar close to it sell excellent breakfast, subway less then 5 min walk, only 3 stops away from termini. Rooms are nice and clean. We only slept there!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: MarianneNearLeeds Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located in a very quiet side street near to the Metro and an excellent bus service that goes to city centre and tourist spots. The nearby cafes and shops are also good. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful - made a booking for us at Villa Borghese and gave us travel information. The breakfast is good value for money, with a wide choice of enough food to set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “After you find it, you will love it!”
Reviews.Author: rosesilly
Reviews.Content: After getting off the metro it took 10 minutes to find, but check in was smooth. Pros: clean room, in fact the lady who serviced it was so wonderful. great location, with awesome food joints nearby, and MORE IMPORTANTLY, if you hate taking the quick metro, you can take 1 bus to the middle of all the roman action (ie piazza Venezia) and when you are tired, it comes back late at night too. Cons: bad breakfast, save your Euro and have a Canolli/pastry across the street at the local cafe with outdoor seating area where you don't even have to pay a sitting fee. So many choices and its open late with awesome machiatto. customer service was iffy,: sometimes great like needing directions, sometimes not so, like a call to reception was dropped more than once. if you turn on the TV, you hear it in the bathroom. ie there are speakers that you cant turn off in the bathroom if your tv is on. With so many hotels to choose from in Rome, we were skeptical about the location but ended up loving this hotel because of the location and it made for interesting times.

Reviews.Title: “Its a winner”
Reviews.Author: dianeelizabeth
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5/9/10 - 9/9/10, Staff very pleasant, hotel very clean, nice area, room was large clean, everything you could ask for.A little bit out from the tourist attractions but a lazy 5 minute walk to the underground and you were anywhere you wanted to be. local area had restaurants, bars and bottle shops. We do need to mention one of our group got locked in the bathroom for 35 minutes but a nice young man from reception kicked the door in and we were upgraded to an executive room and compensated for it. This was a great hotel and would recommend it to anyone, but a word of advice if there are three adults staying the fold up beds are only good for children.

Reviews.Title: “Marcure Piatta Bologna is a very good hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean, well equipeed, friendly staff and at good price.

Reviews.Title: “pathetic- Never stay there or loose your money”
Reviews.Author: deepakkhadaria
Reviews.Content: One really cannot imagine that guest staying in the hotel would loose his money from the Reception safe locker... We check in the hotel on the late evening of 3rd Oct. 2010. Though there was a locker in the room almirah, however, keeping in mind that we are staying in rome, we thought that locker at the Reception would be 100% safe. So we kept 1000 euros in a folder, which was inside a file, in the morning of 4th Oct. 2010 and locked the safe and fruther the reception manager gave one key to us. we took the jey with us. when we came in the late evening back to the Hotel, we took the entire file out and went to our room. However, on checking the folder, we found that the entire kept in the plastic folder, was missing. Everything else was there except the money of 1000 euros. Immediately brought this fact to the Hotel authorities. However, nothing was done and by that tme, it was already mid night and next day early morning, we had the further bookings for Venice and then for the cruise, so couldn't spoil the entire trip. Not only this, we also gave a written complaint to the Mercure Hotels, General Manager, as well as Duty Manager. and specifically told the Manager at the Reception, that while going back we had to come back to Rome, so look into the situation and find out our money...However, nothing was done...When we came back to the Hotel on 15th October, 2010, we were told that nothing can be done... Further, written various mails to the hotel authorities as well as to Accorhotels.com about this incident, no reply was received. Really disappointed with the stay at Mercure, Balogna, Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, good value”
Reviews.Author: PossetPortishead
Reviews.Content: Just back after a long weekend with a group of school friends on one of our annual European city reunions (we're all in our 50s now!). The hotel appears to have been recently refurbished, with a clean modern look. Staff were very helpful. I can't vouch for the breakfast, as we chose to use a local cafe instead (Euro 2-3 per person, rather than 13). Beds are very comfortable and bathrooms very well appointed. My only criticism is the lack of hanging space in the wardrobe - not enough for 2 people on a 3-night stay. Very easy access to the city centre from the nearby Bologna metro station. For great value food close by, I would recommend Il Tunnel - a great neighbourhood trattoria - friendly, welcoming - nothing fancy, just good tradtional Italian fare, with some good house wines. We ate there 2 nights out of three. Book ahead at weekends and eat early - we were lucky they could fit our group of 11 in at short notice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very clean and near metro”
Reviews.Author: DjFluffUk
Reviews.Content: After reading some terrible reviews of other hotels, we were relieved that this one met our expectations. The hotel was very clean, the staff were all friendly and they all spoke good English. The hotel was in a nice area but unfortunately there were no tourist attractions within walking distance. However, with the metro so close we did not find this to be a problem as the nearest metro was a 2 minute walk away from the hotel. We would stay in this hotel again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Cost/Benefit”
Reviews.Author: vanjacobson Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with an excellent cost/benefit. Clean rooms and excellent service. Location is near metro piazza bologna which gives you the ability to move along the city metro's line.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: RonTizz Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite clean and basic, with a good breakfast. Well located right on the subway line, five stops from the very centre. I would recommend this as a great value in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to everything and area was great.”
Reviews.Author: 2tarbolton Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel. The staff were great and very helpful. Everything was convenient. The metro was close by and you were in the centre withing minutes. The area was really nice. Family area with lots of shopping, restaurants and a laundry right across the street. Great value for money. The only downside was that we were on "City Breaks". I could have made a better sandwich with nothing. Two pieces of bread with one piece of salami and a few pieces of cherry tomato on it. A couple of bad peaches and a bottle of water. Wasn't even worth the effort to make the sandwich, much less eat it. Least appetizing thing we had our whole trip. If you are going to offer something, then a least put some effort into it. We didn't take the lunch the other days we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Estrategic location”
Reviews.Author: antigorbr Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mercure Piazza Bologna is located at 5 minutes walking from Piazza Bologna subway station, and it has nice and quiet neighborhood. The room and bathroom are clean, although they are quite small but this is not a problem at all if you need only a comfortable and peacefull place to take a rest after a long walking day.. Efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “booking”
Reviews.Author: upscom Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel to book the room,I was told, that there were no rooms available, I then went to your wbsite and I was surprised to be able to book not only y room, but also the one for my customer. When I arrived to the hotel I asked the reason for their behaviour, but they were unable to give me n answer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, except for service”
Reviews.Author: Marcos156Brazil Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fine, well located, near metro, although not many options of restaurants nearby. Comfortable facilities. But... service is terrible, probably a characteristic of Italy. Breakfast was a mess, all items missing, from dishes to coffee (the only coofee machine was broken down); poor quality items, lack ov variety; sluggish and unkind attendants also. In Ibis in Paris and in Madrid there was a much better service for half the price!!! Internet in the PC at reception did not work for 4 days in a row; when I asked when it would be fixed, answer "A ticket was already open". Not even toilet paper was added to the room. When I complained, answer was: "but the room is clean" No problems with check-in and out, fortunately. Best regards Marcos

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in good area”
Reviews.Author: chartravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and convenient to the Bologna metro stop. The staff were slightly indifferent, but not unhelpful (the bartender is an exception, he was very nice). The room was a bit on the small side but definitley not a problem, and the balcony was a huge plus. Bathroom was very clean and nicely renovated. The neighborhood had several nice shops and there were many restaurants close by which served great food at reasonable prices, much more economical than eating in the historic center. The only problem I had: BEWARE the international phone instructions on the the telephones in the rooms. They connect you to a 3rd party that will charge your credit card a ridiculous amount for even the shortest of calls! I made a ONE Minute call to Canada to let my family know I had arrived and when I returned home my card has been charged $45.00 Canadian! Also when you are making the call the prices are not stated to you, you will not know what you have been charged until you check your card statement. The best choice would be to NOT USE THE ROOM PHONE at all. That is my advice to you :) otherwise, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great value modern hotel easy trip to the city”
Reviews.Author: Frenchie0209 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 3 stops by metro to main station in a quiet leafy district, coffee shops and restaurants nearby, bought the rooms on a special deal so great value

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Karena-macarena
Reviews.Content: Mercure Piazza Bologna was a lovely place to stay for someone who wants to do Rome on a budget whilst still staying somewhere clean and to a certain standard. The room was quite small but we were not too fussed as we spent little time in it and this was made up by the fact it was so clean and tidy throughout our stay. We like many others have said used the metro to travel into the centre of Rome everyday, which was very easy and convenient from the hotel. The metro was very cheap also (Only 1euro per journey made within 75mins) so the saving made by the location of the hotel, staying a little further out worked out much cheaper for us than staying in the centre of Rome. The only problem we found that although there were a couple of restaurants nearby, which were ok, there was a little lacking of restaurants in the area, but then me and my boyfriend are the sort to like trying something different food wise most nights...so others may not mind soo much. But overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Made Rome feel like Home”
Reviews.Author: phans
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. The service was helpful, rooms were clean and the breakfast was tasty. The bathroom was a little tiny and the shower didn't drain so well but that was very little concern to us. It was a very short walk to the Bologna Metro stop which was very convenient. The best thing was being around the corner from Mizzica, which had the best cannoli that we ever ate!!! It also had great Gelato and food snacks!! The place was always packed with the locals. I Preistorici was a great restaurant around the corner. The pizza was fantastic (ask for garlic..mmm) and our favourite server in Rome was there. (we nicknamed him Picasso). Don't forget to buy a purse at Carpisa, which is also nearby. We definitely recommend this hotel:)

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrazilianTraveler30 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Although not located in the city center, it is very close to a Metro Station, which solves the issue. Staff is quite nice, although not a 100% helpful as they could not give accurate information about transport (part of the days we have stayed at the hotel, the subway station was closed for labor reasons and we had to find out by ourselves that there was shuttle provided by Metro company from the station to closest working one) or restaurants (we were recommended to have dinner at a hotel which was closed that day.) Other negative point was paying EUR25 for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, clean, comfortable, and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ah_dallas
Reviews.Content: After Researching for a reasonably priced nice hotel in Rome that is close to the center and tourist attractions we found a promotional price on Mercure web site and based on the good review and the attractive price we reserved 2 rooms for 4 nights. We were not disappointed on the hotel location, comfort, cleanliness, and staff. The hotel is in a quite residential area which properly contributed to the reasonable price but it had very easy access to the main Rome station and tourist attractions. Bologna Metro station was about 2-3 minutes away then we could get to Termini station within few minutes. We felt safe walking in the neighborhood and there were pizzerias, little eateries, cafes, bakery, bars, ATM, and super market around the hotel mainly on the way to metro station. I also remember seeing an Internet café on a side street around the hotel. The rooms were clean with comfortable queen beds, small fridge, safe, and nice bathroom with speaker connected to the TV. However this speaker had no use for us but it was just something different. We didn’t try the hotel bar or breakfast so I can’t comment on them. The hotel had a parking garage that was pricey and since we were staying for 4 nights and would be using the subway, we found out that it is cheaper to return the car saving the parking fees and hire a taxi to the airport upon departure. The staff was professional and very helpful. They helped me in finding the right place to return my rent car and helped me on hiring a taxi to the airport after my stay. They also provided me with directions in the city, recommendations, and a little handy map. I believe that this hotel had a good value for the money compared to other Rome hotels. Liked: Price, location, comfort, and staff. Didn’t like: I wish they had connecting rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A nice,clean,quiet & spotless hotel - the staff were very polite and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Al0n_C
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank Mrs. Anna Martucci, the manager of the Mercure Roma Piazza Bologna for the great hospitality and kindness. We had a problem to confirm our flight back home (a Tel. number. issue in Rome). Mrs. Anna Martucci ,personally helps us to confirm the flight!! Since we were staying 7 nights at this hotel, we just enjoyed our time there and the hotel is definitely one of the best in Rome in its price group. ** Breakfast is excellent for an European 3 star hotel. ** Clean rooms ** The bed is very comfortable (queen size). ** Very quite residential area, 3 minutes from Bologna underground, Busstop very near the hotel. We would recommend this hotel to our friends visiting Rome. Thanks again Mrs. Anna Martucci. Alon Cohen.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmalucy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights whilst in Rome, The room was large and very clean. We paid approx £70 a night. Internet rate non refundable. It is approx 10 mins from Central station. The only down side is we where unable to find a restaurant nearby. The receptionist did recommend one, it had no one in it. We ended up sitting in a take away place and having pizza and beer. it was very nice. Takeaway is on the main road if you appraoch the hotel clockwise from the underground. You will see chicken being cooked at teh front. The following evenings we ate in the centre and had no problem finding places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a residential area well connected with centre”
Reviews.Author: Usenko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May 2009. The stay was pleasant, nothing to complain about. The hotel is located in the residential area the next door to a civil school. From our room we could see the school sports area. One day we are awaked up by noise of children holiday that was at the school. Room was quite spacious and modern designed. Bathroom was nice also. The hotel is well connected to the Rome centre by subway. The subway station is located very close to the hotel. Lots of eateries are around, but we ate at the centre. Hotel breakfast was average, nothing special. Hotel features private garage, but it is overpriced. We arrived by a car and managed to find a free space to park 200 meters away from the hotel entrance. However the surrounding streets are overcrowded by cars and it is very hard to drive through even! Because cars are parked sometimes not correctly with every empty space.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not too far from anything, but the rooms were way too hot at night!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsG1405
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good choice for us as two couples who wanted to stay close to the city but couldn't afford to stay right in the middle! Only 2 minutes walk from Bologna Metro stop, the location was great and the area around the hotel was friendly. Rooms were clean, and not too bad size wise although the bathrooms were a little snug! Good Points: * Close to Metro (250 metre walk then only 2 stops/5 mins from Termini) * Close to a supermarket and lots of little bars/cafes/pizzerias (we bought our breakfast from the bakery up the road and ate it in the little courtyard at the hotel - the staff seemed fine with this) * Free of charge fridge in the room with 4 free bottles of water on arrival * Free safe Bad Points: * Air conditioning in the hotel is automatically switched off between midnight and 9am which is just crazy. The rooms get really hot at night and even keeping the windows open didn't help that much. We visited in June and the temperature in the daytime was approx. 32 and the nighttime temperature was about 20 - I dread to think what the hotel rooms would be like in July or August! Our tip was to leave the aircon set to 5 degrees when you went out in the evening so that the room cools down enough to see you through most of the night - we found that by doing this, sleeping with just a sheet and keeping the windows open we could sleep until about 6:30/7:00 am before we woke up because we were too hot! * The right hand lift had some serious malfunctions! Avoid the right lift if possible - we saw a few people complaining about it but it wasn't fixed whilst we were there. * The cost of breakfast at the hotel was extortionate (see tips below for good alternatives locally) Our Tips for Rome: * If you are coming from FCO airport - get the train to Tiburtina (8€) rather than the train to Termini (14€) and then you can either get the Metro to Bologna or walk to the hotel from Tiburtina station itself. It is about a 10 minute walk up Via Lorenzo il Magniffico (plenty of nice places to grab a drink/snack if you need sustenance following your flight!) to Piazza Bologna and then a 3 minute walk from there down Via Ravenna to the hotel. If you get the train to Termini (as we did on arrival) it not only costs 6€ more but takes twice as long. The walk from the train platform at Termini to the Linea B metro platform takes at least 10 minutes and involves lots of stairs and pushing through crowds - not ideal if you have a suitcase! * If you come out of the entrance to the hotel and walk up Via Arezzo and turn left onto Via Ravenna there is a lovely gelaterie on the corner and a really good pizza place about 4 or 5 doors down (Pizza Tonda) - it doesn't look like much but the pizza is sold by weight and 2 generous slices as well as a 'suppli' and two soft drinks came to less than 7€ - not bad at all once you have experienced the prices of eating in Rome! * The supermarket is well hidden but surprisingly easy to find - it is on Via Lovorno about 50 metres down on the left hand side - it looks a bit like you are walking into the trade entrance but you're not! * The bakery you will pass on your way to and from the Metro called 'Le Panizzeria' offers an amazing croissant/pastry and a coffee/juice for less than 2€ which you can then take back to the hotel with you - the hotel offers the same breakfast for 6€ each - the saving is definitely worth the 2 min walk and back! Tips for Rome: * The three day Metro ticket is a godsend if you are staying in this hotel for 3 nights or more. If you are arriving late on the first day of your trip (and are just going to use the Metro to come from the train station to the hotel) it is worth just buying a single ticket (1€) for the first day and then a 3 day ticket on your second day - the 3 day tickets run on calendar days and so you miss out on a whole day of Metro travel otherwise! * There is only a 15-30 minute wait for tickets at the Vatican Museum if you go anytime between 12:30 and 1:30pm rather than then average 2.5 hour wait at busier times! * If you are planning a vist to the Colosseum, the Palatine and the Forum then head straight out of the Metro and head across the Piazza de Colosseo and then straight down Via di San Gregorio (dodging the ticket touts as you go!) After the street vendors on the right hand side you will see a very small and somewhat innocuous entrance with a small queue - this is the entrance to the Palatine and the Forum and the queue here was only 5 minutes long (at 10am on a Saturday in June) as opposed to the 2hr one at the Colosseum - you can buy a ticket here (12€) that gives you entry to all three and lets you jump the line at the Colosseum. If you do want to buy your ticket from the ticket men (so as not to wait in line at all) then buy them from ones standing right next to the entrance to the Colosseum rather than the ones right by the Metro as they were only charging 4€ extra rather than 13€!! This also applies to buying parasols ladies - the ones for sale by the entrance to the Palatine are only 3€... the ones by the entrance to the Metro are 10€!!

Reviews.Title: “Rome Alone”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTrippers
Reviews.Content: I wanted to do a bit of sightseeing but stay in a safe, quiet and clean hotel and this was perfect. Nice area with a few local eateries, Bologna Metro station a short walk away and No 62 bus covering the entire journey to the Vatican. Getting from FCO airport was relatively easy, taking FR1 local train to Tiburtina for 8 euros, and the metro for one stop to Bologna (bought a Roma Pass at the airport to cover this section of the journey). Post Office right outside the metro station so was able to buy stamps for postcards straightaway. I also had a very pleasant walk to Villa Torlonia park about 10 minutes walk along Ravenna/Nomentara whilst there. On the downside, I ended up with a room with twin beds, which were too close to the wall, but the small bathroom was beautifully clean with a good shower over the bath. There was a safe provided which had to be swiped with a credit card, which seemed to defeat the object of a safe if you wanted to keep the credit card inside it? TV didn't work and had to provide my own travelling kettle to make a cup of tea, although four bottles of water were provided free of charge in the fridge. Comparing it to other hotels in Rome I had read about, I considered it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Superb experience”
Reviews.Author: AnnapolisTravelers
Reviews.Content: I don;t know why some others are complaining - maybe they're used to huge rooms in American cities - this was spacious (for Europe!), and just right for us! Wonderful location in residential district of Rome, 2 blocks from subway, plenty of buses within two minute wals, lots of local restaurants (much better and cheaper than those in heavy tourist areas). Four subway stops from Colosseum and ancient region of city. Had a breakfast at a terrific pasterie 20 meters from hotel (the hotel did have a pricey breakfast, but as vegetarians, we did not choose that option. Most highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: asg81
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with great rates. Our room was the standard double room, yet was spacious, clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom is small but well set out given the space limitation. Situated in a residential area, the metro is a 2 min walk away and there are plenty of restaurants/cafes nearby. Internet access was available in your room for about 5 Euro an hour. Good laundry service at a reasonable price. Staff are helpful, friendly and spoke English. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Non central Hotel but close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: STEVEFR
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated very close to Piazza Bologna Metro stop. This area is not walkable from the main tourist area of Rome but just a few stops on the metro. The area around the Hotel is mainly residential and very quiet at night. It appeared also to be safe to walk though not alot of activity near the Hotel. A few restaurants near the Hotel but again not a busy area at night. More busy in the mornings with a number of near by cafes Rooms clean not huge but fine. TV english channel content very limited as per normal in Mercure / Novotel. Reception friendly and efficient. If you are travelling from FCO airport by train. Rather than catching the direct airport train to Termini station and then transferring to Metro you can get the FR1 local train which stops at Rome Tibertina which is a short walk from Hotel (10 Mins). This train costs only eur5.50 and is half the price of the airport train and then does not involve a change onto the metro as you can walk from Tibertina if your bags are not to big. The Roma pass seemed to be good value and gave unlimited train and buss travel and also included 2 free entry to many historical sites. Note if you go to Coliseum the Forum is also included and does not count as second site. If the price is good for this Hotel whilst still in the city it is not central but certainly a good option and in a very quiet and safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvments, Pretty cheap and disorganised”
Reviews.Author: NeD421
Reviews.Content: I had booked a double room as i was travelling with my wife, but was given a twin room instead, as the hotel did not guarantee a double, which i found off considering that i have booked a double. I was upgraded to a better room on complaining but i still did not get a king size bed or even a queen size bed for the rest of my stay with them, all i was given was two twins put together. The hotel front office staff were very lost though they did every thing to help us with the blunders made by their reservation department. The hotel is far from the main attractions as mentioned by many others, but is walking distance to the Metro which i found very convinient, there are a few good Italian restaurants around the hotel, and as Rome was our last stop in Italy, we were there for four days, though even four days are not enough to explore this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, Clean, lots choice buffet for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bluebird2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights while we were in Rome. The location is really convenient, near Bologna stop on Line B of Rome Metro, about 5 minute walking distance. The Bologna Piazza is also a stop of bus 62. I think that Line B of Rome Metro might stop running after 10:00pm, since one night, we found Metro was closed, and bus 62 took us right back to this hotel. Room is very clean. The size is on the smaller side comparing to U.S. suburb hotels, however, similar to City hotels. Since we were only two people, the size was adequate for us. The service is kind of laid back. They did not go out of their ways to help us. However, it was just fine with us. The restaurant they recommended were good in value, food are good, price is reasonable(we think), about 200 meters from the hotel. We had two dinners there. While there, we met many fellow tenants. I guess that they got the same recommendation. Breakfast is included in your room rate, many choices, very nice. We definitely will be back if we ever went back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: YolaOttawa
Reviews.Content: Hotel's staffs are friendly and helpful; rooms are very clean and comfortable. Next time in Rome, we’ll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: AhNOUR
Reviews.Content: The location is quiet far from any attractions , but it's near the metro station, I bought the Roma Pass and i enjoyed taking public transportation , you can find from any place a bus which will drive you to piazza bologna . The hotel staff in the reception is strange , it depends , you can find a very unfriendly man who rarely smiles in your face , and a very friendly girl ... it depends. The breakfast buffet is poor . The room space is very small , but it was clean and also the Bathroom was fine and clean. If you are going to have a city sightseeing , no problem to stay here as it is very near to the Metro , and you only use your room for sleeping. Have a nice holidays

Reviews.Title: “Close to Metro..”
Reviews.Author: GLScott
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights here. The bar and waiting staff were all very friendly and helpful, however we found the Reception staff quite unfriendly, and stand-offish. They barely said hello and goodbye to us on arriving and leaving. The hotel itself is located in a relatively quiet residential part of the city, outside of the centre but literally 5 minutes walk from the Metro which surprisingly was clean, easy to use and not frightening as it is in some other countries. It costs 4 Euros for a day pass and we used it all day long to get about from one site to the next. Much cheaper than taxis. The breakfast at the Mercure was ok - scrambled eggs, fried thinly cut ham, cold ham, salami and cheese and a selection of breads. The bar always serve food when you order a drink such as olives, ciabatta with ham, pizza, cheeses - a cheap little meal! Useful, seeing as they don't do meals (although you can order a microwaved frozen meal form the bar). The rooms were spacious enough for all of our stuff, the bathroom lovely and clean. Really good air-con, which is a must as the evenings were warm. They have a small selection of movies you can watch in your room for roughly 10 Euros each. You can use the internet downstairs but it's really expensive, so I wouldn't recommend. This place was great if you're just looking for a clean, convenient place to sleep and hold your stuff if you are planning to spend your whole day/evening in the city itself. There isn't a great deal to do near Piazza Bologna itself and there's quite a walk to the nearest store for small grocery items (we went to the store at the Metro Termini instead!) Oh and there's no iron in the room. To loan one, you have to get it from reception and take it to the chambermaid's room. This was really weird especially when the maids found us there ironing - so take a travel iron!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: subwaygirl
Reviews.Content: had a very enjoyable stay! Although it says that the hotel is a 3 star I would give it 4 stars! the room was spotless as was the onsuite bathroom! staff were friendly and very helpful!! I would definitly stay again!! Thank you Mercure for all the above!!

Reviews.Title: “not a bad hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: Flyingsds
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel for a short trip, satyed 2 nights, whilst a little out of the way it is a short 3 min walk to the metro and 2 stops later you at the main terminal so not a problem really. the hotel is suited in a quiet residental area of Rome and it is nice. The hotel itself is clean comfy and exceelent value, the staff are helpful and it is pretty cheap as well, so if you dont mind being a little out of the way and are happy to use public transport this hotel is very cost effective way of staying in rome without having to spend that much (cost us 90 euros for 2 nights w/c 17th Aug)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Surprise”
Reviews.Author: TripComment
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is just a 5 min walk to the Metro Station or Bus station. It takes not more than 15 min to arrive in downtown. . Hotel is modern and has nice decoration. Bath room are pretty large, although the room is a bit small, but more than acceptable. It is located in a quiet area, and you can fins easily parking area around the Hotel if you want to avoid to pay the Hotel parking. Breakfast is good, In concluison I will say tjat is a very good choice for who wants to decide to visit Rome and stay awat from all the confusion of the downtown.

Reviews.Title: “it's good with special price”
Reviews.Author: hsianghsiangw
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in this hotel on the website with a special price. The normal price would be too expensive for me. Though only staying for one night there, I felt it best among the places I stayed in the journey in Italy. The room is clean, quiet and the bathroom is so great. I think most people stay there may be businessmen. In the bathroom, of course you can take a hot bath in the bathtub but also hear the news from the ceiling once you turn on the tv in the room. The location is only 5 minutes from the metro station once you find the direction. I can say the location and the room of this hotel is quite a good standard with good price in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, close to metro station Bologna and Termini train satation”
Reviews.Author: Nuagee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located close to Bologna metro station and Termini train station. Not a tourist district so you can eat and have a drink for less money. I recommend the restaurant Braci e Abbraci 136, viale delle Provincie Roma for an excellent meal at an honest price. It is close to the hotel. The price of the breakfast 13 euros is a bit high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: NormaJeanRoma
Reviews.Content: the location is near Piazza Bologna, a central quarter of Rome, but dont expect to find famous buildings to visit; its near the main university of Rome and the biggest hospital of Rome;the metro "B" is 5 minutes walk; the surrounding area is full of life with restaurants, pizzerias, buses from and to the central station Termini, shops, diners, patisserie; the hotel is a three star, the room was for three people , with twin beds and a sofa transforming in a bed;the room is spacious enough for two, fully equipped with color tv and pay tv ; the fridge have 4 bottles of water, free from charge, only these, if you want somthing morer you have to go to the bar inside; the negative points are that the roo walls are a little dirty and so the curtains, with a lot of dust in the upper side; only few sanitary towel in the bathroom and the the location of the wc is a little uncomfortable; anyway a good stay

Reviews.Title: “Watch our for overbooking”
Reviews.Author: jbonifacino1
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at 9 PM after a trip from Naples, only to find out that my room had been given away to someone else. My company had made reservations more than a month in advance. At the beginning the employees were not completely candid about why this had happened, but ended up admitting that it was due to overbooking. I was obviously very upset about not having a room to sleep that late at night. They offered to place me in another Mercure hotel that was 2 km away. They paid for the taxi to take me there. The next day I returned to this hotel, which resulted in a lot of time wasted traveling, checking in again, etc. I stayed at the hotel for three days. It was OK but unremarkable: internet connection is expensive, no breakfast included, etc. Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For us; this is the place to stay in Rome, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TheBebek
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in the city centre, but it's only 5 minutes walk from Piazza Bologna station. Piazza Bologna is not a touristy area so it's nice and quiet and you can actually experience the daily life of the local people. There are enough nice bars (cafes) with as well as restaurants for dining options and because the area is not a tourist area, you are paying reasonable prices (not tourist prices). Hotel's staffs are also friendly and helpful, rooms are comfortable and very clean. Next time in Rome, we know this is the place that we'll choose to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Gustavoh
Reviews.Content: Stayed there December 29-January 2, during my first visit to Rome. The location is not exactly in the heart of Rome, but it is just a couple of blocks from the subway, so no complaints there. It is actually in a less touristy area which was fun to explore, and there were a couple of nice neighborhood restaurants nearby. The building itself and the rooms were typical Mercure. Nothing special, but generally modern and nice. The room was relatively spacious, with a large and comfy bed and a large bathroom. There were a few signs of wear and tear here and there, but the room was overall well kept. The front desk staff were generally helpful and friendly. It was an overall pleasant experience and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jatl2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the best part of our travels through Europe. We began in London, then Paris, and then enter the Mercure! WOW! The hotel is in a quite area of west Rome near the university. Great reception area, bar area, dining room. The rooms were by far the largest of all we stayed in. Corner room with view of the street on the 4th floor. The decor was very sheik and very comfortable. Flat Panel TV with speakers even in the bathroom ceiling for your listening pleasure. Bathroom was HUGE, beautiful blue tile!!! I was so very impressed by this Hotel for so many reasons! The bar area, very nice, cozy and bartenders very friendly and eager to speak with anyone. We spent two evenings in the bar before venturing out to dinner, talking with the bartender and exchanging stories of our culture and he about his. It was a great experience! Reception staff was also amazing. One evening I negelected to close my room door all the way and the front desk clerk actually called to inform me of this and asked if i was ok. I was very impressed. Tube station close by, several great restaurants and beautiful piazzas.

Reviews.Title: “Good, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trekkersocal
