Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we were looking for a relatively cheap option in a good location in rome. The hotel is not located in the historic center of rome (if that's what you're looking for, do not book here). The place is located near piazza bologna - this is 2 stops from the termini on line b of the roman metro. The metro station is about 150m away, and very close. The nighborhood nearby is actually very suburban, there are a few cafes, restaurants were far and few. There is a very good restaurant i prehistorici which is located very close to the restaurant - a local favorite it seemed as everyone else was italian - their seafood pasta was to die for and very reasonably priced. Otherwise, however there was not the tourist bustle that you would expect. Rooms were standard Mercure hotel rooms - clean beds, quiet room, a refrigerator, TV, night stands, and nice bathroom. room was average sized for europe. Safe was also included. No free internet, breakfast was extra 6 euros for italian, 13 euros for continental breakfast. did not try anything at the hotel cafe/bar so can not comment on the food. For its location and being so close to historic center of rome, it was a great buy and bargain. There is an internet point across from the hotel with much better internet rates (2 euros/hour vs. the 32cents/minute they were going to charge). i would stay at this hotel again, but be warned that there is not much to do nearby. I would give the hotel 2-3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Room had balcony!”
Reviews.Author: Dirtyminx2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mercure Piazza Bologna for 3 nights with my boyfriend. It is a fantastic location. It is 2 stops from main train station which is right in centre of Rome. The hotel is lovely. Not much character at all but is a great price (327 euro for 3 nights double room)for decent hotel in mddle of Rome. Locality was quiet, very safe and people were friendly. Was 11 euro for taxi from Corso-hotel which is not bad at all! Breakfast was horrible. We ordered room service night before. It said it was continental breakfast-bread was a bit too chewy for my liking ' selection of fruit and yoghurt' included one wrinkly apple and pineapply yoghurt. Apart from breakfast, I couldn't fault the hotel. Staff were friendly enough and quite helpful! Had fantastic stay in Rome. Would definitely stay at Mercure again because of price, cleanliness and proximity to city centre. Make sure to try tiramisu ice-cream gorge! Fontana di Trevi takes your breath away-so beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and comfortable but away from centre”
Reviews.Author: Joana_pt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mercure Piazza Bologna for two nights as a pre-cruise stay. It is an Accor standard hotel, modern and comfortable. The rooms were not big but I wasn't expecting them to be big anyway. We had buffet breakfast at the hotel, good quality but not much variety. We had dinner once at the hotel because we were just too tired to go out for dinner (there were not any nice restaurants near the hotel). They only had one type of salad and ham&cheese toasts. Although both were good, we would expect it to have more options (in the elevators it was stated that the restaurant had a wider variety). The hotel is located 5 mins from Piazza Bologna underground station, which is 3 stations from Termini (which is connected to Fiumicino airport by Leonardo Express). However, if you're carrying heavy luggage, you might want to consider taking a taxi (it cost us 28 eur for 4 ppl and luggage from Termini). Overall it was a good option. We just felt we would have benefited from a more central hotel, which would have enabled us to rest for a while around lunch time and thus avoid the hot sun.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: JunuTrivedi
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on the hotel website on the assumption that a respected international chain like Mercure will be reliable in their descriptions and the price will be justified. We booked for 5days at an average rate of Euro 170 per night (without breakfast). Reaching the hotel wasn't easy. We arrived at the airport, then took the train to Stazione Termini where the change to the Metro line was horrible especially if one has luggage. The Metro station is a long walk away and the stations have several stairs and no elevators. After reaching the Bologna stop, we had to drag our luggage for quite a while and ask for directions before we reached the hotel. The hotel itself is clean but very mediocre in terms of space and facilities. It is in the middle of some residential area and not really as 'close' to the centre as the Mercure website would like us to believe. The staff was pleasant but didn't really help. There was no one to help with luggage either. All the above troubles would be fine if we were not paying the kind of tariff we did. It was just not worth Euro 170. Maybe, Euro 80 would be a good price for such a hotel. After staying one night here, we checked out spent the next day looking for hotels near Stazione Termini and found a great 4 star hotel. Here we paid only Euro 165 a night and had breakfast included. The hotel was very clean, the rooms and showers were large and it looked every bit of the 4 star hotel it promised to be. And, the best thing was that this hotel was bang in the middle of the centre and 2 minutes walk from Stazione Termini, very well connected to all the places of interest, very close to nice eating places and full of activity. So, why should anyone pay so much to stay at this far away and average hotel called Mercure Rome Piazza Bologna ?

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Mercure !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ozcookie1
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located close to the Metro in a residential part of Rome. It's only a few minutes walk from the station but is a little tucked away . We spent the night before on a train and so arrived early at about 9am to leave our bags and were amazed when we were allowed to check-in and go straight to our room. The rooms were decorated in a contemporary fashion, were large and quite modern. The bathroom was of a high standard also. We got a great rate by booking directly through the Accor web site the day before. We loved the fact that this hotel is not in the tourist quarter and hence there were some wonderful little cafes and bars nearby. We had a fantastic meal at the little pizza restaurant nearby and can thoroughly recommend the bar/cafe/gelato parlour that is in the middle of the roundabout across from the Metro station. This hotel was one of the unexpected highlights of the trip-a quality hotel, at a reasonable price, in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ccwh
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed at this hotel while we were visiting Rome on holiday. I had searched for the best prices, and found that it was actually cheapest to go via the hotel's website, although web rates meant that no amendments could be made. We had a triple room (1 king sized and 1 single bed) and based on the hotels I have stayed in Europe, the Mercure Bologna had very large and comfortable rooms. The room was very clean and comfortable, and provided a welcoming place to relax in after a long day of sightseeing. The web price did not include breakfast so I can't comment on that, although when I saw another person's room service, the quality of the food looked good. The hotel is situated on the blue Metro B line, and is 3 stops from the main train station, Termini. To get to the hotel from the Bologna Metro station takes about 5 minutes, and there are lots of shops and restaurants in between. There was no air-conditioning in our room, but as the weather was quite cold, that wasn't an issue. It is a comfortable and clean hotel, and its close proximity to the main tourist areas made it very convenient to get back to. Adding in the reasonable web prices, this is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in Europe. My family and I enjoyed our stay in Rome, and enjoyed the hotel very much as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryan180680
Reviews.Content: I must say this hotel is excellent. We paid 240 euros for a 3 night stay and when we arrived we were shocked to see that it costs 240 euro's for 1 night! Excellent location and approx 5 mins walk from the metro station, very easy to find. Rooms are decorated to a very high standard with free safe, fridge and great blackout curtains. The only downside is that the school that backs on to the rear was quite noisy in the mornings, nothing major though. I would definately recommend that if you are planning a visit to purcahse the Roma pass from the tourist information platform 24 at Termini station. It costs 20 euros and it gets you free tarvel for 3 days plus 2 free entrance into tourist attractions and then discounted after the first two. We went to the colloseum, roman forums, palentine and didn't pay a penny. If we would of had to pay then it would have cost 30 euros each, saved us so much money.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Piazza Bologna is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: JoJo1Buffalo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mercure Piazza Bologna for 4 nights as part of GoAhead Tour. It was a fabulous, super-modern hotel. The location was great-not in the middle of things but close enough to the trains to easily get to all the major spots. Trains are very easy to navigate around on. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and spacious. Breakfast buffet is wonderful. Staff was very courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: snowflake170
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a tour. The hotel room was very small with a small bathroom, but seemed modern and clean. The breakfast was nice with a lot of variety and there was a nice bar area at the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, easy access”
Reviews.Author: Ockert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We arrived after 22:00. Reception was friendly and helpful. For European standards a very good breakfast. Reasonably sized room, very clean, free internet access in the foyer. Before booking, I consulted Tripadvisor reviews. Although in a quiet area with not much nightlife, it was quiet at night. The metro station (Piazza Bologna) is very close (appr 150-200m), with several buses also stopping at Piazza Bologna, with Bus 62 having its point of departure at Piazza Bologna, and its end at the Vatican, making this trip SOOO easy. We requested an extra pillow, and got it without hassle (as opposed to our experience at a paris hoteldays later). Rooms were sound proof, and we had a view over the city and into the neighbouring schoolyard. Traveling to all sights by metro were easy, even going back to the hotel to freshen up before taking the streets again. I will recommend this hotel with great plesure and should I ever go back to Rome (our coin is in the Trevi!), will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CasalBrazil
Reviews.Content: Very good, clean and quiet hotel. A nice option in Rome. The hotel is located near the subway station, just three blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BirdyQuébec
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Mercure. Here's our impressions: - large rooms (for Europe) - large bathroom - very clean - excellent AC (thank God!) - excellent breakfast: scrambled eggs, sausage, cheese, bread, croissants, juice and of course coffee. Elegant dining room - friendly and helpful staff - soundproof rooms - free water each day in the small frige ! - safe in the room (lock/unlock with credit card) - sat tv: italian, french, CNN, BBC, sports Not in the center of Rome but a 2 minutes walk from the metro, 3 stations from Termini. You can get the Coloseo in 30 minutes ! On a small calm street but very near commercial streets: shops and restaurants. The Preistorici on via Cremona (100 meters) is very nice, very good and much cheaper than the central restaurants. Would go there again. Jean and Nancy

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mongkang
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel. It may not be right in central Rome but it has lots of little interesting shops, cafes and restaurants within easy access. It is very safe as we took walks to nearby restaurants at night. It costs 10-12 euros to get to Roma Termini which wasn't bad at all! Rooms are clean and breakfasts good. Foyer is a wee bit small as it was constantly crowded with people and very busy and noisy. My friends and I stayed here a couple of days prior to joining the Trafalgar Tour group at Holiday Inn, Rome West which turned out to be in a horrible location. Would have rather stayed at the Mercure any time! Reception staff were friendly and cheerful and helped us get around and booked us for tours around Rome. A very pleasant stay and will certainly come back again for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: David_Brown
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome for 4 days on 28th May with my wife + 13 yr old daughter & found this hotel to be a great base to see the sites. Room was clean, quiet & comfortable. Some suggestions/ comments: • Try booking via [--]. We received a much better rate than that displayed at the hotel • Leonardo express train from Fiumicino airport to Termini station takes about 30 mins & costs €11 • Hotel is less than 5 minutes from Bologna metro station (2 stops from Termini & 5 from Colosseum) so easy to get around • Bought Roma Pass for adults from the Tourist Information office at Termini (also available at tobacconists) at €20 for three days unlimited travel on metro/ buses, free entries to first two sites/ museums & half price others • Bought 3 day travel card for daughter at €11 as entry to sites/ museums is free for under 18’s from EU countries (take an id to prove EU citizenship – I used my driving licence) • Use the Roma card at the Colosseum (normal entry €11) as this also enables you to bypass the normal (long) queues • We downloaded an MP3 commentary for the Forum/ Colosseum from www.walki-talki.com at $7 which even our daughter found interesting! • A number of good restaurants in the area of the hotel, especially Braci e Abbracci (at 136 Viale delle Provincie, by the Piazza delle Provincie a 5 minutes walk from the hotel) with splendid food and a lively atmosphere at a reasonable price Enjoy Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with very good amenities”
Reviews.Author: italiauno
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mercure was great for me. Since I was already accustomed to Rome, I knew that the Metro and bus stops were close by (2 min. walk max.) and those would link you with the center of Rome quickly. The hotel is on a side street, and faces less of the noisy traffic of Piazza Bologna than being right in the square. The room was modern and clean, with a very nice shower. In some rooms, there is a speaker in the bathroom, so that you can listen to the TV/music stations while in the bathroom. The breakfast in the morning was GREAT, combining Italian breakfast items with American items, such as scrambled eggs. Overall, given the price, location, and typical "hotel" factors, I would recommend this hotel willingly and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel (by European standards).”
Reviews.Author: Love_TravelNewYork
Reviews.Content: The hotel has small modern rooms and they are very clean. There is no air conditioning in April. You can cool the room by opening the windows and then closing them at night (to stop noise). It is a quieter neighborhood then the rest of Rome. The lights were fine at night. We walked around at night and did not have a problem. The restaurant 2 blocks away (the hotel recommends it) is excellent. The free buffet is fine (eggs, great italian pastrys, juice, coffee, yogurt, cereal). No pool or bathtub (just shower). The refrigerator in the room gets 4 bottles of free water. They call it a minibar but its free. You need the map to find the hotel. the piazza had 5 roads so we still needed help from a passer-by to find it. Get the Roma Card. 3 days of unlimited transport and free admission to certain museums and discount to jump off and on trambus. At track 24, walk out the nearest door (don't walk to the front) and you get it from tourist information. The Metro is old and very crowded. The metro on the corner is 5 stops directly to the coleseum (go late in the day to minimize lines). We took the last english tour at 5 PM and beat the whole line for 3.5 Euros. The 42 Bus goes from the hotel to the Vatican. More fun, less hazzle than the Metro. Returning the last stop is our hotel. Going the last stop is the Vatican. I recommend it. I would learn how to use the bus. The arrow on the sign points the direction the bus is going and the boxed name is the stop you are at. The Vatican has 15,000 people per day. When we got there, there was a line of 3000 people for the St. Peters Basilica (don't get on this line). We took the tour because we did not know where to start (don't take it). We spent one hour in the sun before going into the museum to look at a poster of the Sistene Chapel. It took 5 hours without food, water or a bathroom. One roman fainted (good thing we had the buffet breakfast). They took us to a line to the Vatican Museum outside the wall (start here). Once you go thru the museum, you must take the exit on the right from the Sistine Chapel (make sure you have the right exit). Then you get into Saint Peters Basica with no line.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but the location is not great”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveller1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights. The hotel itself is clean and the rooms have a decent size. Overall I would say it is good value for money. The breakfast (which was included in the price) was not great; the choice was somewhat limited. Some of the staff in the restaurant were quite rude. The hotel is located in a quiet area and only a few minutes away from the tube station which makes it a good base for sightseeing. The area itself is a bit rough though and there were not many lights, so it was actually a bit scary when walking back to the hotel in the darkness. There is not a huge choice of decent restaurants within walking distance. Having said that there is an Italian restaurant just two minutes away from the hotel which offers good food at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality”
Reviews.Author: Lamers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. When you'll have your first look into the room it seems small. When you are used to it, it is okee. The beds are very good, there is a tv and a minibar with only 4 bottles of water in it, free of charge, every day. The badroom has a bath, toilet, bidet and a hairdryer. There is a little basket with shampoo, showergel ect. Breakfast is a buffet with: coffee, orangejus, toast/ scrumbled eggs/ bacon/saucages, bread, croissants, fruits, yoghurt. It's only 5 minutes walk to the metro and busline 62( stops at the collosseum). Not too far, at the other side of piazza bologna, there is a supermarket in the Via XXI aprile. A green/ red logo: SMA. Just around the corner you can find a restaurant/ pizzeria which i would recommend: i pre-historica. I read a review here saying there where dirty sheets, which i could not beleive for an accor-hotel. I think they meant the over-blanket in red( see photo). It was not changed for 5 days( and yes, there was a spot in it).

Reviews.Title: “Modern but small room”
Reviews.Author: gover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure Piazza Bologna for 4 nights. The rooms have modern features but are very small unless you have one the balcony rooms. The bathroom is also small and is a bit tricky to get in and out of the shower. Our room was kind of hot and we couldn't seem to find a way to regulate the temp besides opening the window. On the plus side, when we called down for an extra pillow, one was brought up very quickly and breakfast was good with quite a few choices. The hotel isn't in the heart of things but the metro stop is close by so we didn't have much trouble getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KC333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure Piazza Bologna from 15th August for 7 nights 2006 (Family of four). The hotel is modern and bright. The staff were very helpful and extremely welcoming. Chiara the receptionist was superb, answering our queries cheerfully for us and Paulo the barman was very helpful also. The rooms we had were not huge, but they were spotlessly clean, bright and modern, with comfortable beds and lovely bathrooms - exceptional value for Rome. The hotel is situated a few metro stops away from the main tourist area, but it took only 10-15 mins to get from the hotel into the centre. The buses were excellent too - very frequent and cheap. We bought a Roma Card from the tourist information room at Termini station. For 18 euros each, this gave us 3 days of unlimited use of transport within Rome, free entry for 2 major tourist attrations and 50% discount on the rest. Exceptional value, as the Colleseum itself is 11 euros to enter. The bonus is that with a Roma card you also skip the main queue - just queue to the left at Colleseum and you get in within minutes instead of hours! Loved Rome and loved the hotel. Highly Reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mercure Piazza Bologna”
Reviews.Author: great-places
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Mercure Piazza Bologna in April 2006 for 4 days. The hotel desk staff (all english speaking) was most helpful with us scheduling a guided tour of the catacombs. We had an American breakfast each morning that was good. The best American coffee we had on our 10 day trip to Italy. Our expience was very positive and our hats off to the Mercure!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel, so helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for just one night. The hotel and our room was modern, comfortable and clean, and the fact that breakfast was included in the 128 Euro price was the icing on the cake. The real bonus however was the helpfulness of the staff, we had recommendations for good eateries, but no idea where they were. The staff spent about 10 mins with us searching the phone directory to find them, and then gave us the metro and tram details on how to get there, thanks guys! Oh, and please do find the address on a good map search engine before you go, it can be difficult to find the hotel from the Piazza Bologna metro station, but if you know which street to take from the piazza it's a doddle and less than 5 mnutes walk
